meanings.definition: Proteuses: a plural noun referring to a group of mythical sea gods capable of changing shape at will.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of proteuses who could transform into any creature they desired.
meanings.sent2: The proteuses swam gracefully through the ocean, shifting forms as they pleased.
meanings.sent3: The proteuses decided to have some fun by turning into playful dolphins and surprising sailors.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to adapt to any situation earned her the nickname 'the proteus of the office.'
meanings.sent5: The proteuses' shapeshifting powers made them both mysterious and unpredictable.
